file_content.text: Your help will be remembered.
My lord, I have reports from the conflict with the Republic.
You have my thanks. You are, if I am not mistaken, the young Sith who took the Brentaal Star, yes?
Good. Time was running out. Wait... aren't you the agent who was involved in the taking of the Brentaal Star?
Lord Kras? I was hired to deliver these reports from Lieutenant Mallohe.
Thank you. Do I have the honor of addressing an entire group of the heroes that captured the Brentaal Star?
Fascinating. You are the bounty hunter who was involved in the capturing of the Brentaal Star, were you not?
Tell me, what were your impressions of the Republic forces you fought?
They stood and fought to the last man. It was a glorious battle.
They are worthy opponents.
Then there will be many chances for glory in the days to come.
What the Republic lacks in passion, they make up for in organization.
Don't underestimate them.
You may have a point there. Our leaders are often distracted by more personal concerns.
The Jedi leaders fight exceptionally well, but the enlisted men don't measure up to our own.
They are a complex group.
They spread themselves too thin, recruit too many to defend too much that is strategically worthless.
Their troopers are getting some solid kits. Lots of recent hardware and advanced armor.
Tough guys, good weapons.
Fascinating. Which means they are preparing for war, despite what their politicians say.
One Imperial soldier is worth twenty, thirty of the Republic's grunts.
Pathetic, every one of them.
Then this should be a very short war.
I thank you for your insight and these reports. If you'll excuse me, I must study them before giving the Minister of War his marching orders.
I delivered your reports, that's all I'm here for.
I've got better things to do.
Very well. Here is your fee. Begone.
Of course. My thanks. Good day.
Do not disturb me.
